name: Dad's Homemade Corn Dogs
author: BetterCookingForSingleFathers
summary: My son loves corn dogs, but I despise all the additives in store-bought. This recipe makes us both happy!
directions: Combine cornmeal, flour, white sugar, baking powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl; stir in milk and egg until batter is smooth
Bring a large pot of water to a boil; cook hot dogs until heated through, about 7 minutes
Let hot dogs rest for 10 minutes and dry hot dogs on a paper towel
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Insert 1 skewer into each hot dog
Pour batter into a large drinking glass
Dip hot dogs into the batter until well coated
Fry 2 to 3 hot dogs at a time in the hot oil until lightly browned, about 3 minutes
